lines.content: * Class containing the main method. Establishes current session's Ui, TaskList, and Storage,
* and cues Ui to begin taking input from the user.
System.out.println("File could not be loaded. Starting a new save file and list...");
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* When Ui and new Duke object has been created, this method
* will support the ongoing session and quit once the Ui stops receiving input.
* Enumerations meant to direct the actions of Ui and Parser classes.
EXIT, LIST, FIND, DELETE, DONE, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, INVALID;
* Class designated to take user input, and parse it into a format that can be used by the Ui.
* This returned output is typically in the form of a String or integer, otherwise the class
* will return an invalid output that is handled by the Ui accordingly.
* This method detects keywords within the user's input, matches them to an enumerated action,
* and returns the enumeration which tells the Ui class how to behave.
* @return ActionType enumeration--one of nine instructions for the Ui.
* A class meant to save the user's ongoing list by writing the data onto a file. When a new session begins,
* the Storage class will attempt to read the referenced file to re-create the list from prior sessions. If it
* cannot read the file, it will write a new file. As the user adds/deletes/completes tasks, the Storage class
* A method used when a new Duke session begins. The Storage class will try to read the referenced
* file to recreate the list from the earlier session, or it will create a new file to record the
* @return It returns an ArrayList with all the tasks from prior sessions' task lists, or an empty
* ArrayList if no earlier data is found.
* @throws IOException When Storage is unable to locate/read the file.
System.out.println("File could not be found. Starting a new file and list...");
public void updateTasks(TaskList tasks) throws IOException {
private Boolean writeInFile(String savedText) throws IOException {
System.out.println("I couldn't save your information to the file.");
* Standardizes the Task List and makes it more easily parsed when the file is being referenced in the future.
* @return The returned String is printed into the save file.
* A class for the storage of the user's current list of Tasks. As the user puts in more
* commands affecting the list of Tasks, the TaskList designated to the session will update.
* The constructor method for the TaskList class. Upon being created, the TaskList will attempt
* to use the saved data from Storage, though if it cannot find a prior list, it will
* @param savedList The ArrayList used to organize Tasks in TaskList. It may contain prior Tasks from
* Child of Task class, different in how the user must specify a '/by' time in order to
* successfully create this task. If the time is formatted in a specific way, the time
* will be converted to a formatted 'Date'.
* Child of Task class, different in how the user must specify an '/at' time in order to
* successfully create this task. If the time is formatted in a specific way, the time
* will be converted to a formatted 'Date'.
* An abstract class--parent to ToDo, Deadline, and Event classes. Users can create
* a Task to add to their session's TaskList. The constructor takes a taskName at minimum, though
* certain subclasses require a designated time as well.
public enum TaskType { TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT;}
private String dateOutputPattern = "MMMM d, yyyy h:mma";
* Method with the same functionality as getTime, though it has not been overridden by subclasses.
* Used mainly when saving a Task's time to a file.
* @return Returns the time without additional strings added in the overridden getTime()
public String getBasicTime() { //Needed a function that wasn't overridden by subclasses.
//No date matched, thus we will not give the field a value.
* Child of Task class that does not require a time in order to create the Object.
* All the ToDo class requires is a taskName.

private String dukeGreeting = "Hello, I'm Duke.\nWhat can I do to help you?";
private static String dukeNeedsValidInput = "\tI'm not sure that I understand. Could you reformat your request?";

* A looping method that will continue taking input until the user types "bye". Each line of
* input is sent to be parsed. Once it is returned, Ui determines what to do, and how to respond.
// The user will enter commands from this point onwards.
String response = "\tHere are the tasks in your list:\n";
String response = "\tHere are the matching tasks in your list:\n";

+ "\tNow you have " + tasks.getNumberOfTasks() + " task(s) in the list.";
String response = "\tNice! I've marked this task as done:\n";
return "\tYou can't add any more tasks to your list!";
String output = "\tGot it. I've added this task:"
